titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Sanford, Indictment
CWG5356

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Montgomery Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
vs } Indictment
John Sanford

The Grand Jury of Montgomery County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse John Sanford of the offence of Horse Stealing committed as follows to wit: The said John Sanford on the 1st day of January 1864 in the County and Circuit aforesaid did willfully & feloniously take & Steal & carry off a certain horse the personal property of Jesse Yates of the value of more than four dollars Against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

J D Dury
Comh Atty
A Copy
Att
J. M. Crawford Ck.
By T C Barnes D. C.
Commonwealth
vs } A Copy
John Sanford
